Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Private equity has always been a sought-after asset class due to its performance potential.

However, steep entry barriers, including high minimum investments (~€10m), hefty paperwork and the challenge of selecting the right fund have traditionally kept individual investors at bay, with access largely limited to big institutions or a select few.

Enter Moonfare.




We've made investing in private equity more accessible and straightforward with our fully digital investment platform. Now, qualified investors can access some of the most sought-after private market funds at lower minimum investment amounts*.




The diverse Moonfare team – which includes alumni from top private banks, groundbreaking startups and beyond – is united in pushing boundaries and redefining the private equity landscape.




Join us!




Data Analyst (m/f/d)




At Moonfare, we are on a mission to democratise access to top-tier private market investments. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data informed decision making across the organisation. You’ll be part of a small, high impact team that sits at the intersection of data engineering, product, marketing, and commercial, enabling the business through actionable insights, scalable reporting, and high quality data models.




You will shape how we understand performance, measure success, and identify new opportunities across the company. Your work will help ensure that decisions at Moonfare are always backed by clear, well structured, and meaningful data.




You will:

Develop and maintain advanced SQL-based data models to power business reporting and analysis
Build scalable dashboards and self service tools using Tableau, enabling teams across Moonfare to access key metrics and insights
Perform exploratory and strategic analysis to support product launches, marketing campaigns, and commercial initiatives
Partner closely with product managers, marketing, and business stakeholders to understand goals and define relevant KPIs
Lead experimentation efforts including A/B test design, implementation, and interpretation
Advocate for data quality and consistency, ensuring models and reporting are accurate, well documented, and easily understood
Collaborate with the wider data and analytics team to improve data infrastructure and analytics tooling
Drive initiatives that increase data literacy and empower teams to use data more effectively




The next Moonfarian:

Has 5–7 years of experience as a Data, Product, or Marketing Analyst
Has a proven track record of transforming data infrastructure and metrics to support business growth
Possesses advanced SQL skills (BigQuery, PostgreSQL), along with strong Spreadsheet and Tableau proficiency; experience with dbt and Snowflake is a plus
Has hands-on experience working with commercial, product, or marketing datasets
Is comfortable designing and interpreting A/B tests and leading experimentation efforts
Collaborates effectively across both technical and non-technical teams
Communicates clearly, takes ownership, and is passionate about driving business impact through data




If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!




Our Values:

Our clients come first, Moonfare comes second, and we prioritise ourselves third - Client-Centric Focus. Putting clients first means creating value for them is essential. Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together. We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.




We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We’re committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone — regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity — knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.




*Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.




Apply now!

We’re committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone — regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity — knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.


*Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.


Apply now!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We’ve partnered with a market-leading digital business behind some of Europe’s biggest lottery, charity raffles, and e-commerce gaming platforms — combining technology, marketing, and data to reach millions of users across Germany.




They’re now looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to help elevate how they measure and optimise marketing performance. You’ll lead work on Marketing Mix Models, multi-touch attribution, and incrementality testing — helping ensure every euro of media spend is working as hard as it should.




📍 Location: Hamburg / Berlin (Germany-based, 1x/month in office)

Salary: €60-80k- Dep on Experience!




What You’ll Do

Build and refine MMM and attribution models across all major marketing channels
Run incrementality tests, geo-experiments, and holdouts to measure true impact
Turn data into actionable insights for smarter media planning and budget allocation
Collaborate with teams across CRM, performance, finance, and data engineering
Partner with vendors like Meta and Kantar on measurement and validation
Create dashboards that help teams understand performance and make informed decisions




What We're Looking For

4 years + in Marketing Data analytics
Must have experience with Python or R, and SQL
Must have hands on and proven experience with MMM and attribution modelling
Solid grasp of causal inference, experimentation, and regression techniques
Comfortable working across multiple marketing channels
Clear communicator who can explain data to non-technical teams




Sound like your kind of challenge? Apply now!

Sound like your kind of challenge? Apply now!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben bei uns


Your responsibilities





Manage and analyze large datasets from multiple sources (SQL databases, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, etc.)


Automate recurring reporting processes (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, etc.) and reduce manual work


Build dashboards and reporting pipelines that provide clear insights into campaign and funnel performance


Conduct advanced statistical analysis (regressions, predictive models, machine learning approaches, attribution models) to uncover insights and optimize decision-making


Support the team in developing and refining a multi-touch attribution model


Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure data accuracy and transparency across all channels



Das bringst Du mit


Your profile





Strong background in data analysis with excellent SQL skills


Solid understanding of marketing metrics and KPIs (especially in paid performance marketing)


Experience in automating data workflows (Python, R, or similar is a plus)


Knowledge of statistical methods, regressions, or machine learning techniques (plus)


Hands-on experience with data visualization and reporting tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)


A structured and detail-oriented working style with a passion for solving complex problems


Proficiency in English; German is a plus but not required



Das bieten wir Dir


What we offer





A chance to make a real impact in healthcare recruiting


A dynamic and fast-growing environment with room to take ownership


Collaboration with a passionate and international team


Hybrid work model from our Berlin office


Competitive salary and development opportunities





As Marketing Data Analyst at Pflegia, you will be the go-to person for everything related to marketing data. You will structure, analyze, and automate our reporting processes to enable data-driven decision-making at scale. You will work closely with our performance marketing and product teams, but your main focus will be data analysis and automation rather than campaign management.




At Pflegia, our mission is to transform the healthcare recruiting industry by connecting qualified nursing professionals with the right employers faster and more efficiently. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

At Pflegia, our mission is to transform the healthcare recruiting industry by connecting qualified nursing professionals with the right employers faster and more efficiently. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (Part-Time)
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a part-time Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone highly analytical and detail-oriented, who enjoys working with data sets, developing insights, and driving data-informed decisions. You’ll provide actionable insights through meticulous data analysis, supporting strategic decision-making across teams.

What You Will Do


Collect, compile, and clean large and varied data sets, ensuring their accuracy and reliability.
Develop, maintain, and optimize comprehensive reporting dashboards using analytical tools like Superset and Netsuite.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify meaningful trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with various internal teams to ensure accurate and insightful reporting that informs strategic decision-making.
Continuously enhance data quality, reporting processes, and analytic methodologies.



What You Should Bring


Experience in data analysis or related data-centric roles. A great benefit if related with sales.
Proficiency in data management, analysis, and visualization; familiarity with Superset and Netsuite is a strong plus.
Strong analytical capabilities, with demonstrated experience in interpreting complex data.
Attention to detail with the ability to ensure high accuracy and clarity in reporting.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating data insights clearly to different stakeholders.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days’ holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customized training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Our interview process


CV review
Interview with one of our Talent Acquisition Team Members
Hiring Manager Interview
Task
Hiring Team Interview



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we embrace innovative technologies to enhance our recruitment process. We leverage artificial intelligence during screening interviews for CV reviews and note-taking. We prioritize transparency and respect your preferences, so you'll have the option to opt out of recording and AI-driven note-taking while still receiving full and fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office).

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/priv

Title: Game Data Analyst - All in Hole
Description:
Homa is a global mobile game developer and publisher creating games people love. We partner with studios and internally develop games, having launched over 80 titles, reached over 2 billion downloads, and seen our game All in Hole break into the global top-50 grossing charts. These are milestones, not the finish line.

With deep expertise in product and technology, we built Homa Lab, our proprietary platform that gives developers the market intelligence, data tools, and game tech, with AI built-in, to find product-market fit fast and scale mass-market games into lasting experiences players enjoy for years.

This is our flywheel: Homa Lab helps studios spot the right ideas early, turn them into games quickly, and reach millions of players. Every launch brings back data and insights that fuel the next hit, making each turn of the loop faster, smarter, and more likely to win. AI supercharges this process, running through everything we do, from everyday tasks to our guiding principles.

What powers the loop is talent density. 220+ people from 30+ nationalities, bringing expertise from the world's best studios and companies. We uphold ambition, curiosity, humility, and focus, and deliver with speed, excellence, and candor.

Since the start, we've raised $165M from Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Bpifrance, and the founders of King, Sorare, and Spotify, people who've built and backed the games and platforms we admire, now supporting our drive to create the next ones.

At Homa, we are building the next billion-player experiences from the ground up and shaping the future of entertainment.

Meet the team 👩‍👩‍👧‍👧

You will join the Data department organized into:


A Data Platform team with 6 Data Engineers responsible for ingesting large amounts of data from multiple different sources, creating and maintaining a core data model which aims at making data standardized, reliable and easily available
A Data Science and ML Platform team with 4 Data Scientists / ML Engineer working on ML-driven data products: Autobidder for User Acquisition, N-Testing for experimentation
An Advanced Analytics & Data Science team with 7 Data Analysts exploiting our data for:
Game Analytics
User Acquisition and Marketing Analytics
Market Inteligence Analytics
Ops Analytics
Role and Missions — What you will do 🚀

As a Senior Game Data Analyst dedicated to All in Hole, our most ambitious hybridcasual puzzle game, you will play a critical role in shaping the game's roadmap, balancing creativity with data-driven insights. This role requires a keen analytical mindset and expertise in translating complex data into strategic decisions. You will work closely with the Product team to achieve our goal of placing All in Hole in the top grossing games.

Your Key Missions:


Drive Game Success through Data: act as the primary data authority for the game, influencing game strategy and development through a deeply data-informed perspective
Collaborate Closely with Product Management: partner with the Product teal to design a roadmap guided by robust analytics, supporting both creative direction and user engagement
Set Up Data Tracking & Reporting Pipelines: define event tracking for core gameplay and user interactions. Build and automate reporting pipelines to monitor essential game metrics in real time, ensuring reliable data insights are always accessible
Analyze and Report on Game Performance: provide actionable recommendations based on detailed analysis, from player behavior to in-game purchase patterns, to refine game mechanics and user experience
Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: serve as the primary point of contact for A/B testing across the game's features. Design, plan, and execute complex tests; analyze results to support statistically sound decisions that directly impact the game's roadmap


Requirements

With strong data analytics experience, you want to join a diverse team composed of mobile gaming enthusiasts. If you recognize yourself in the following description, you're the one!


2-4 years exp. as Advanced Data Analyst or Data Scientist working on Mobile Games (ideally casual puzzle games on the product side)
Technical skills to analyse data (SQL / Python EDA - Analytical mindset) and automate processes (Python script / dbt / Tableau)
Some experience with economy design is a plus
We need a doer mindset as we are still a small team and need to do things outside of our job description when they can have an impact
You love playing mobile games
You are fluent in English (interviews will be led in English)


Our Culture—Who We Are🪐

At Homa, we prioritize talent, energy, and determination over traditional credentials. We're building a global community of brilliant, driven people who think boldly, move fast, and push boundaries. We believe true innovation comes from diverse perspectives, deep collaboration, and curiosity without limits. Our culture is grounded in four core values:


Ambition: We strive for the best - we don't settle for "good enough."
Humility: We recognize that we are always learning, we can always improve and grow
Curiosity: We continuously seek the "why" behind the "what"
Focus: Our curiosity takes us deeper, not wider - we dive deep into the details


Benefits

Building great games starts with building a great place to work. Here's what you can expect:


🏥 Comprehensive Benefits: Depending on your location, you'll enjoy a range of perks such as insurance, meal vouchers, public transport, gym memberships, and more
🏢 Paris HQ Access: Enjoy a desk at our private office in a well-located WeWork building that will give you access to WeWork perks like rooftop view and designed coworking spaces
🌍 Coworking Access: You will have access to WeWork spaces throughout Europe, along with all their perks and professional office environments
🌐 Global Team: Collaborate in English with top-tier talent from 35+ countries, spanning Europe, the UK, the US, and more. Diversity fuels our creativity and innovation
✈️ Team Gatherings: We value time together beyond the screen. Join us for occasional team gatherings, off-site retreats (Workations as we name them) to connect, recharge, and celebrate
📈 Performance Reviews: We're committed to your growth. Every six months, we reflect on your progress, recognize your achievements, and align on clear development goals
💻 Equipment Support: From day one, we'll provide everything you need to do your best work, including a home office setup allowance if you're working remotely


Where We Hire

Our HQ in Paris is a vibrant hub of creativity, collaboration, and connection. From rooftop lunches and coffee chats to after-work apéros and community events, we've designed a space people genuinely enjoy - all within a cozy WeWork filled with good energy (and snacks).

We also have incredible team members across Europe - from Spain and Turkey to Germany, North Macedonia, Poland, the UK, and more. Whether you're working from a sunny WeWork in Barcelona or your home setup in Warsaw, you're fully part of our culture. To keep collaboration smooth, we primarily hire within European time zones (UTC to UTC+3). If you're based there - or planning to be - we'd love to hear from you!

Please note: this is one remote position open to multiple countries, not multiple openings.
Show more
HTML:
Homa is a global mobile game developer and publisher creating games people love. We partner with studios and internally develop games, having launched over 80 titles, reached over 2 billion downloads, and seen our game All in Hole break into the global top-50 grossing charts. These are milestones, not the finish line.

With deep expertise in product and technology, we built Homa Lab, our proprietary platform that gives developers the market intelligence, data tools, and game tech, with AI built-in, to find product-market fit fast and scale mass-market games into lasting experiences players enjoy for years.

This is our flywheel: Homa Lab helps studios spot the right ideas early, turn them into games quickly, and reach millions of players. Every launch brings back data and insights that fuel the next hit, making each turn of the loop faster, smarter, and more likely to win. AI supercharges this process, running through everything we do, from everyday tasks to our guiding principles.

What powers the loop is talent density. 220+ people from 30+ nationalities, bringing expertise from the world's best studios and companies. We uphold ambition, curiosity, humility, and focus, and deliver with speed, excellence, and candor.

Since the start, we've raised $165M from Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Bpifrance, and the founders of King, Sorare, and Spotify, people who've built and backed the games and platforms we admire, now supporting our drive to create the next ones.

At Homa, we are building the next billion-player experiences from the ground up and shaping the future of entertainment.

Meet the team 👩‍👩‍👧‍👧

You will join the Data department organized into:

  • A Data Platform team with 6 Data Engineers responsible for ingesting large amounts of data from multiple different sources, creating and maintaining a core data model which aims at making data standardized, reliable and easily available
  • A Data Science and ML Platform team with 4 Data Scientists / ML Engineer working on ML-driven data products: Autobidder for User Acquisition, N-Testing for experimentation
  • An Advanced Analytics & Data Science team with 7 Data Analysts exploiting our data for:
    • Game Analytics
    • User Acquisition and Marketing Analytics
    • Market Inteligence Analytics
    • Ops Analytics
Role and Missions — What you will do 🚀

As a Senior Game Data Analyst dedicated to All in Hole, our most ambitious hybridcasual puzzle game, you will play a critical role in shaping the game's roadmap, balancing creativity with data-driven insights. This role requires a keen analytical mindset and expertise in translating complex data into strategic decisions. You will work closely with the Product team to achieve our goal of placing All in Hole in the top grossing games.

Your Key Missions:

  • Drive Game Success through Data: act as the primary data authority for the game, influencing game strategy and development through a deeply data-informed perspective
  • Collaborate Closely with Product Management: partner with the Product teal to design a roadmap guided by robust analytics, supporting both creative direction and user engagement
  • Set Up Data Tracking & Reporting Pipelines: define event tracking for core gameplay and user interactions. Build and automate reporting pipelines to monitor essential game metrics in real time, ensuring reliable data insights are always accessible
  • Analyze and Report on Game Performance: provide actionable recommendations based on detailed analysis, from player behavior to in-game purchase patterns, to refine game mechanics and user experience
  • Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: serve as the primary point of contact for A/B testing across the game's features. Design, plan, and execute complex tests; analyze results to support statistically sound decisions that directly impact the game's roadmap

Requirements

With strong data analytics experience, you want to join a diverse team composed of mobile gaming enthusiasts. If you recognize yourself in the following description, you're the one!

  • 2-4 years exp. as Advanced Data Analyst or Data Scientist working on Mobile Games (ideally casual puzzle games on the product side)
  • Technical skills to analyse data (SQL / Python EDA - Analytical mindset) and automate processes (Python script / dbt / Tableau)
  • Some experience with economy design is a plus
  • We need a doer mindset as we are still a small team and need to do things outside of our job description when they can have an impact
  • You love playing mobile games
  • You are fluent in English (interviews will be led in English)

Our Culture—Who We Are🪐

At Homa, we prioritize talent, energy, and determination over traditional credentials. We're building a global community of brilliant, driven people who think boldly, move fast, and push boundaries. We believe true innovation comes from diverse perspectives, deep collaboration, and curiosity without limits. Our culture is grounded in four core values:

  • Ambition: We strive for the best - we don't settle for "good enough."
  • Humility: We recognize that we are always learning, we can always improve and grow
  • Curiosity: We continuously seek the "why" behind the "what"
  • Focus: Our curiosity takes us deeper, not wider - we dive deep into the details

Benefits

Building great games starts with building a great place to work. Here's what you can expect:

  • 🏥 Comprehensive Benefits: Depending on your location, you'll enjoy a range of perks such as insurance, meal vouchers, public transport, gym memberships, and more
  • 🏢 Paris HQ Access: Enjoy a desk at our private office in a well-located WeWork building that will give you access to WeWork perks like rooftop view and designed coworking spaces
  • 🌍 Coworking Access: You will have access to WeWork spaces throughout Europe, along with all their perks and professional office environments
  • 🌐 Global Team: Collaborate in English with top-tier talent from 35+ countries, spanning Europe, the UK, the US, and more. Diversity fuels our creativity and innovation
  • ✈️ Team Gatherings: We value time together beyond the screen. Join us for occasional team gatherings, off-site retreats (Workations as we name them) to connect, recharge, and celebrate
  • 📈 Performance Reviews: We're committed to your growth. Every six months, we reflect on your progress, recognize your achievements, and align on clear development goals
  • 💻 Equipment Support: From day one, we'll provide everything you need to do your best work, including a home office setup allowance if you're working remotely

Where We Hire

Our HQ in Paris is a vibrant hub of creativity, collaboration, and connection. From rooftop lunches and coffee chats to after-work apéros and community events, we've designed a space people genuinely enjoy - all within a cozy WeWork filled with good energy (and snacks).

We also have incredible team members across Europe - from Spain and Turkey to Germany, North Macedonia, Poland, the UK, and more. Whether you're working from a sunny WeWork in Barcelona or your home setup in Warsaw, you're fully part of our culture. To keep collaboration smooth, we primarily hire within European time zones (UTC to UTC+3). If you're based there - or planning to be - we'd love to hear from you!

Please note: this is one remote position open to multiple countries, not multiple openings.

Title: Junior AI Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Operations & Analytics team partners with stakeholders across Merchandising, Buying, Operations, and Products Quality & Safety to inform timely, quality decisions about Zalando’s business with its suppliers. We enable commercial decisions, process improvements, standardisation, and workflow automation.

Are you excited about challenging the status quo, pushing the boundaries, and leveraging data and AI to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle e-commerce? This is your chance!

As a Junior AI Data Analyst, you will develop your analytical expertise while contributing to building business-critical solutions. You'll work with cutting-edge tech tools to support KPI tracking, explore data sources, analyse datasets, and help solve business problems. You will be part of the world-class Analytics@Zalando community that offers various opportunities to network, share best practices, and grow.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


This is where analytical expertise meets excellence to empower our stakeholders to make timely quality business decisions!



Immerse yourself in your business partners' world to understand their pain points and develop your business acumen. Proactively seek guidance from more senior colleagues to identify opportunities where data can unlock value and deliver insights that shape decisions, earning your stakeholders’ trust through reliable execution and clear communication of your findings.
Contribute to building our self-service analytics foundations by supporting the development and maintenance of data transformation pipelines and AI models. Learn to build reliable data products that stakeholders can trust, while ensuring data quality through rigorous testing and documentation. Collaborate with senior team members to enable stakeholders to answer their routine questions independently.
Support in building game-changing AI-powered applications that automate processes and workflows. Assist in implementing AI solutions that improve operational efficiency and partner experience, while learning and applying best practices in productionising data and AI applications pipelines.
Actively engage in technical discussions with engineering teams and senior analytics colleagues. Learn to evaluate technical trade-offs, contribute ideas, and develop your ability to make sound technical recommendations under guidance.




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You hold a Master’s in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field and gained 2+ years of professional experience in data analytics or data science.
You have hands-on experience designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using SQL and Python on cloud data warehouses and lakehouses (ideally, AWS Redshift and Databricks). You are eager to learn orchestration tools like dbt and Apache Airflow.
You demonstrate proficiency in at least one data visualisation tool (Tableau, Looker, or MicroStrategy) and show strong potential in using data storytelling to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and actionable insights to non-technical audiences.
You have foundational knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering), practical GenAI applications, and deploying solutions in production.
You follow software engineering standards in version control (Git/GitHub), CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), and code documentation best practices.
You demonstrate intellectual curiosity, critical thinking, and a growth mindset. You're excited about leveraging AI in analytics workflows while maintaining analytical rigor in evaluating outputs.
You show strong communication skills, eagerness to develop business understanding, ability to manage your time effectively, and enthusiasm for translating analytical findings into business recommendations. You thrive in collaborative environments and actively seek feedback to accelerate your personal and professional growth.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SoundCloud empowers artists and fans to connect and share through music. Founded in 2007, SoundCloud is an artist-first platform empowering artists to build and grow their careers by providing them with the most progressive tools, services, and resources. With over 400+ million tracks from 40+ million artists, the future of music is SoundCloud.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work closely with the product and engineering teams to ensure accurate data capture of the experiences we build and then mine the data to generate insights that drive product innovation and monetization. You will use your advanced SQL skills, analytical mindset, and storytelling abilities to uncover user behavior patterns, identify opportunities, and measure the impact of new features/functionality through experimentation. You will also create dashboards and insights reports to communicate your findings and recommendations to various stakeholders, from product managers and engineers to leadership and executives.

Drawing on your strong commercial sense, you’ll partner across functions to shape product and go‑to‑market decisions that fuel the expansion of our content ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Leverage content economics and user behavior data to recommend the right tracks and creators to listeners, define and track KPIs for subscriptions and other revenue streams, and pinpoint opportunities to optimize spend and boost ROI.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify the opportunity space for the product teams based on user needs, preferences, pain points & friction in the user journeys.
Lead the charge on hypothesis‑driven testing; creating the infrastructure that fast‑tracks experiments on content curation, listener experience, and interface enhancements to maximize growth.
Communicate data-driven insights & recommendations to product, engineering, design, and leadership teams using clear and compelling narratives, visualizations, and presentations.
Collaborate with other analysts, data engineers, data scientists, and product managers to ensure data quality, consistency, and alignment across different data sources and platforms
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and documentation to share best practices, learnings, and institutional knowledge across the organization.


Background And Experience


5+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, data science, or a related field. Direct experience within Commerce, subscriptions, freemium based businesses, streaming services, Social, Commerce, Gaming is a plus.
Expertise in SQL and experience working with large-scale data sets on cloud platforms such as GCP or AWS.
Experience with analytics engineering tools such as Apache Airflow, Dataform, dbt, etc.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with event tracking, design and tag management solutions such as Segment, GTM, Adobe Launch, Tealium, etc.
Experience in designing, running, and analyzing complex A/B tests and experiments using one or more of the leading experimentation solutions. i.e. StatSig / Optimizely / Target.
Strong analytical skills and ability to apply statistical methods such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, clustering, forecasting. Experience building churn and retention prediction models
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations for different audiences.
Curiosity and passion to find & elevate the data narratives and exercise influence to drive change.
Experience in mentoring and training analysts and non technical stakeholders
Passion for music and interest in understanding user behavior and preferences in the music domain.


About Us


We are a multinational company with offices in the US (New York and Los Angeles), Germany (Berlin), and the UK (London)
We provide a flexible work culture that offers the opportunity to collaborate and connect in person at our offices as well as accommodating work from home
We are deeply committed to ensuring diversity, equity and inclusion at all levels of our organization and fostering a community where everyone’s voice, perspective and experience is respected and heard
We believe a strong team is made by investing in employees through mentorship, workshops and enrichment opportunities


Benefits


Not located in Berlin? No worries, we offer extensive relocation support including allowances, one way flights, temporary accommodation and, by partnering with Expath, on the ground support on arrival
Interested in a gym membership, photography course or book? We have a Creativity and Wellness benefit!
Employee Equity Plan
Generous professional development allowance
Fertility and Family Building program
Flexible vacation and public holiday policy where you can take up to 35 days of PTO annually
We offer free German courses at beginning, intermediate and advanced
Various snacks, goodies, and 2 free lunches weekly when at the office


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at SoundCloud

SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization; they help us lead what’s next in music by understanding and empowering our creators and fans, no matter their identity. We acknowledge the challenges in the music industry, and strive to influence an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute respectfully and thrive, especially the historically marginalized communities that many of our creators, fans and SoundClouders identify with. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment at SoundCloud for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, migration background, national origin, age, disability status, or care-giver status.

At SoundCloud you can find your community or elevate your allyship by joining a Diversity Resource Group. Diversity Resource Groups are employee-organized groups focused on supporting and promoting the interests of a particular underrepresented community in order to build a more inclusive culture at SoundCloud. Anyone can join, whether you share the identity or strive to be an ally.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Reporting & Visualisierung: Du bist verantwortlich für die Erstellung von Kundenreportings sowie für die Konzeption, den Aufbau und die Pflege aussagekräftiger Dashboards in Power BI für interne und externe Stakeholder.
Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst Kampagnen- und Nutzerdaten und leitest daraus klare Empfehlungen für Sales, Marketing, Produkt und unsere Kund:innen ab.
Datenaufbereitung & Qualität: Du entwickelst und pflegst effiziente Abfragen in Power Query / SQL, modellierst Daten und stellst deren Qualität und Konsistenz sicher.
Prozessoptimierung: Du dokumentierst und optimierst laufende Prozesse und Workflows im Bereich Data Analytics.
Sonderanalysen: Bei Bedarf konzipierst und führst du Ad-hoc-Analysen für Kundenprojekte durch.


Dein Profil


Power BI: Sehr gute Kenntnisse, einschließlich DAX, Datenmodellierung, Visualisierung und Power Query.
SQL: Sehr gute Skills für Datenextraktion und -aufbereitung.
Hohe Kompetenz in Stakeholder-Kommunikation.
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch (C2) und gute Englischkenntnisse (B2).
Mindestens 3 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in Datenanalyse oder BI.
Gutes Verständnis für Projektmanagement-Prinzipien.
Grundkenntnisse in Python für Automatisierung und Analysen.
Praktische Erfahrung im Einsatz von KI für Analytics.
Branchenbezug zu Digital Marketing oder Gesundheits-/Pharmabranche wünschenswert
Ausgeprägte Lernbereitschaft, Eigenmotivation, Anpassungsfähigkeit und Resilienz.
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Abstraktionsvermögen und Sorgfalt.


Wir bieten Dir


Ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, das Dein Know-How zu schätzen weiß.
Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz mit einer unbefristeten Festanstellung ab dem ersten Tag.
Die Möglichkeit für ein konzentriertes Arbeiten und genug Raum für Deine Ideen.
Sehr flexible Regelungen zur Anwesenheit im Büro, zum Arbeiten aus dem Homeoffice oder von einem anderen Ort aus.
Eine individuelle Entwicklung – fachlich wie persönlich – durch Schulungen, Workshops und Trainings.
Eine auf Dich angepasste betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Die Wahl zwischen einem Deutschlandticket oder einer Urban Sports M-Mitgliedschaft.
Freie Getränke, den besten Kaffee im Kiez und regelmäßige Events (BBQ, Brunch, Movie Night u.v.m.).
Entspannte Pausengestaltung in unserer wohnlichen Teamküche, im hübschen Prenzlberger Innenhof oder auf einem kulinarischen Kurztrip durch die Nachbarschaft.
Viele nette Kolleginnen und Kollegen in einem bunten, vielseitigen, internationalen und dynamischen Team, das viel Wert auf Respekt, Wertschätzung und Zufriedenheit legt.
Eine gute Arbeitsatmosphäre im Herzen des Prenzlauer Bergs in einer lichtdurchfluteten Backsteinremise mit vielen Pflanzen.


Über uns

esanum ist ein Online-Portal für Ärztinnen und Ärzte. Wir vernetzen fachbereichsübergreifend über 369.000 Medizinerinnen und Mediziner in Deutschland und Europa. Dabei sind wir für die Ärzteschaft Newsportal, Fortbildungsanbieter und Community. Bei uns dreht sich alles um Gesundheit, Medizin, digitales Healthcare-Marketing und (Web-)Technologie. 2007 gegründet ist esanum heute ein solides Unternehmen der New Economy in Berlin mit über 100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern.

esanum ist fest etabliert im Gesundheits- und Pharmamarkt und ist Partner vieler namhafter medizinischer Fachgesellschaften und -verlage. Wir tragen aktiv zur Digitalisierung des Gesundheitsmarktes bei, mit konstantem Wachstum in einer krisensicheren Branche.
Show more
HTML:
Deine Aufgaben

  • Reporting & Visualisierung: Du bist verantwortlich für die Erstellung von Kundenreportings sowie für die Konzeption, den Aufbau und die Pflege aussagekräftiger Dashboards in Power BI für interne und externe Stakeholder.
  • Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst Kampagnen- und Nutzerdaten und leitest daraus klare Empfehlungen für Sales, Marketing, Produkt und unsere Kund:innen ab.
  • Datenaufbereitung & Qualität: Du entwickelst und pflegst effiziente Abfragen in Power Query / SQL, modellierst Daten und stellst deren Qualität und Konsistenz sicher.
  • Prozessoptimierung: Du dokumentierst und optimierst laufende Prozesse und Workflows im Bereich Data Analytics.
  • Sonderanalysen: Bei Bedarf konzipierst und führst du Ad-hoc-Analysen für Kundenprojekte durch.

Dein Profil

  • Power BI: Sehr gute Kenntnisse, einschließlich DAX, Datenmodellierung, Visualisierung und Power Query.
  • SQL: Sehr gute Skills für Datenextraktion und -aufbereitung.
  • Hohe Kompetenz in Stakeholder-Kommunikation.
  • Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch (C2) und gute Englischkenntnisse (B2).
  • Mindestens 3 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in Datenanalyse oder BI.
  • Gutes Verständnis für Projektmanagement-Prinzipien.
  • Grundkenntnisse in Python für Automatisierung und Analysen.
  • Praktische Erfahrung im Einsatz von KI für Analytics.
  • Branchenbezug zu Digital Marketing oder Gesundheits-/Pharmabranche wünschenswert
  • Ausgeprägte Lernbereitschaft, Eigenmotivation, Anpassungsfähigkeit und Resilienz.
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Abstraktionsvermögen und Sorgfalt.

Wir bieten Dir

  • Ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, das Dein Know-How zu schätzen weiß.
  • Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz mit einer unbefristeten Festanstellung ab dem ersten Tag.
  • Die Möglichkeit für ein konzentriertes Arbeiten und genug Raum für Deine Ideen.
  • Sehr flexible Regelungen zur Anwesenheit im Büro, zum Arbeiten aus dem Homeoffice oder von einem anderen Ort aus.
  • Eine individuelle Entwicklung – fachlich wie persönlich – durch Schulungen, Workshops und Trainings.
  • Eine auf Dich angepasste betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
  • Die Wahl zwischen einem Deutschlandticket oder einer Urban Sports M-Mitgliedschaft.
  • Freie Getränke, den besten Kaffee im Kiez und regelmäßige Events (BBQ, Brunch, Movie Night u.v.m.).
  • Entspannte Pausengestaltung in unserer wohnlichen Teamküche, im hübschen Prenzlberger Innenhof oder auf einem kulinarischen Kurztrip durch die Nachbarschaft.
  • Viele nette Kolleginnen und Kollegen in einem bunten, vielseitigen, internationalen und dynamischen Team, das viel Wert auf Respekt, Wertschätzung und Zufriedenheit legt.
  • Eine gute Arbeitsatmosphäre im Herzen des Prenzlauer Bergs in einer lichtdurchfluteten Backsteinremise mit vielen Pflanzen.

Über uns

esanum ist ein Online-Portal für Ärztinnen und Ärzte. Wir vernetzen fachbereichsübergreifend über 369.000 Medizinerinnen und Mediziner in Deutschland und Europa. Dabei sind wir für die Ärzteschaft Newsportal, Fortbildungsanbieter und Community. Bei uns dreht sich alles um Gesundheit, Medizin, digitales Healthcare-Marketing und (Web-)Technologie. 2007 gegründet ist esanum heute ein solides Unternehmen der New Economy in Berlin mit über 100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern.

esanum ist fest etabliert im Gesundheits- und Pharmamarkt und ist Partner vieler namhafter medizinischer Fachgesellschaften und -verlage. Wir tragen aktiv zur Digitalisierung des Gesundheitsmarktes bei, mit konstantem Wachstum in einer krisensicheren Branche.

Title: Intern Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Make an impact by:


Support the Data Analytics team in analysing and interpreting data to provide insights and recommendations that help drive business decisions
Collecting, processing, and analysing large datasets, and presenting findings in a clear and concise manner


Your profile:


Currently pursuing a degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in SQL language; Python/R are optional
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Basic understanding of how data warehouse, architecture and ETL/ELT pipelines work
Ability to translate business requirements into data requirements and present quality output
Excellent communication and presentation skills in professional English , German is optional


We offer:


A unique opportunity combining the energy of a scale-up with the power of BMW, Mercedes Benz Mobility & bp
Working on products & services with a high social impact
An international team of talented people who love what they do and live a collaborative spirit
An open-minded culture with room for growth and the freedom to bring in own ideas
Subsidized gym membership, subsidized office lunch benefit, monthly mobility budget, & much more
modern, sunny offices in Berlin & Munich
up to 2 days of home office in a week
… and of course, the classics: delicious coffee & tea, fresh fruits and an office dog-friendly environment


At DCS we acknowledge the value of diversity, promote equality and challenge unfair discrimination. We strive to create an inclusive work environment, safe for anyone regardless of their gender identity, sexual orientation, abilities, ethnicity or race. We have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions and treat each applicant with the same respect and consideration.

Get in touch!

Excited about being a part of the transition to e-mobility?

Then send us your application with your CV and motivational statement including your earliest starting date and salary expectations.

Don’t worry if you don’t think you meet all requirements for this position. First and foremost, we value like-minded, passionate people who want to make an impact in shaping the future of e-mobility. We encourage you to apply and convince us why you would be a good fit in a cover letter.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst (Data Analytics Team)
Description:
Founded in 2000, JetBrains is a global leader in professional software development tools. We are passionate about making software development a more productive and enjoyable experience through intelligent tools that help developers escape the routine and help their creativity thrive. We conduct various kinds of research for our product teams: IntelliJ based IDEs, Fleet, TeamCity, and YouTrack.




We are currently looking for talented, inventive, and passionate people to join our growing team.




As part of our team, you will:

Develop a system of metrics for the advancement of JetBrains products: where usability problems occur within the product, how changes to the product affect its metrics, and what experiments are necessary to improve the product.
Perform A/B testing, develop testing conditions, and interpret the results.
Provide recommendations for product improvement and search for the best solutions for UX enhancement.
Collaborate with managers, developers, and designers.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to support product decision-making.




We’ll be happy to bring you on board if you have:

Strong analytical thinking skills, including the ability to challenge hypotheses, analyze and structure data, draw conclusions, and interrelate data.
Proficiency in mathematical statistics and practical experience applying it.
Confidence using Python (Pandas, NumPy) and experience with SQL.
Ability to determine the appropriate approach to data assessment: analytics, research, or leveraging external data.
At least one year of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Commitment, strong self-management skills, and meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to solve complex problems under conditions of incomplete data.




Our ideal candidate would have:

Experience solving non-trivial tasks.
A proven ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Previous experience in research-oriented roles.




We process the data provided in your job application in accordance with the Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://www.jetbrains.com/legal/privacy/privacy-recruitment.html)

Title: AI Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Operations & Analytics team partners with stakeholders across Merchandising, Buying, Operations, and Products Quality & Safety to inform timely, quality decisions about Zalando’s business with its suppliers. We enable commercial decisions, process improvements, standardisation, and workflow automation.

Are you excited about challenging the status quo, pushing the boundaries, and leveraging data and AI to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle e-commerce? This is your chance!

As an AI Data Analyst, you will take your analytical expertise to the next level, leveraging cutting-edge tech tools to define and track KPIs, explore data sources, analyse complex datasets, and solve critical business problems. You will be part of the world-class Analytics@Zalando community that offers various opportunities to network and share knowledge and best practices.


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


This is where analytical expertise meets excellence to empower our stakeholders to make timely quality business decisions!



Forge trusted partnerships where stakeholders seek your strategic insights, not just your SQL skills. Immerse yourself in your business partners' world to understand their pain points and effectively translate their business questions into analytical problems. By proactively identifying opportunities where data can unlock value and delivering insights that shape decisions, you'll earn a seat at the table where your recommendations directly influence Zalando’s strategy.
Build the foundations for trusted self-service analytics at scale by designing, developing, and maintaining data transformation pipelines and AI models throughout their lifecycle that business stakeholders can confidently adopt, earning trust through data quality and empowerment, enabling stakeholders to independently answer their frequently asked business questions while you tackle more complex analyses and strategic challenges.
Design and develop game-changing AI-powered applications to streamline and automate processes and workflows to enable Zalando’s business growth, improve customer and supplier experience, drive operational efficiency, and maximise profitability.
Actively participate in architecture discussions with engineering teams and senior colleagues in analytics and tech, evaluate trade-offs, and make sound recommendations.




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You hold a Master’s in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field and gained 5+ years of professional experience in data analytics or data science.
You have proven experience designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using SQL and Python on cloud data warehouses and lakehouses (ideally, AWS Redshift and Databricks), with strong knowledge of orchestration tools (dbt and Apache Airflow).
You are proficient in data visualisation best practices and tools (Tableau, Looker, or MicroStrategy) and have exceptional data storytelling abilities to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and actionable insights to diverse audiences.
You have hands-on experience with statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering), practical GenAI applications, and successfully deployed solutions in production environments.
You uphold rigorous software engineering standards in version control (Git/GitHub), CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), and code documentation best practices.
You exhibit intellectual curiosity and critical thinking to amplify your business impact through strategic integration of AI in your analytics workflows and rigorous evaluation of its output.
You show demonstrated ability to develop profound business understanding, proactively identify opportunities, effectively manage priorities and stakeholders’ expectations, translate business questions into concrete analytical problems, bring industry trends and best practices to the conversation, and make sound data-backed recommendations.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

  • Family services, including counseling and support

  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (f/x/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.


Tasks



Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.


Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.


Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.


Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements



You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.


Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.


Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.


Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.


Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits



Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement


An environment that offers room for personal and professional development


A centrally located office in Berlin City West


Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs


The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products


A pet-friendly environment


Salary progression based on length of service with the company


Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.





At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!




You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.




Get in touch with us now!




Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Data Analyst - Sales (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

About The Job

Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Dublin, Munich, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

Join our Revenue Analytics Team as a Data Analyst, where you'll be a pivotal force in guiding our Sales team with your expertise in sales analytics. Your role is integral to shaping sales strategies aligned with marketing initiatives and our broader business goals. By harnessing data, you will enhance sales effectiveness and foster a collaborative culture across departments. Our Revenue Analytics team works extensively with our Chief Revenue Officer and VP of Growth - if you want direct exposure to senior sales leaders, this is the role for you.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Sales Planning: Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies that are data-driven and aligned with marketing objectives and broader company goals.
Implement AI solutions to conduct go-to-market engineering that directly impact revenue growth and pipeline generation
Performance Analysis and Forecasting: Evaluate sales tactics and forecast trends, providing the Sales team with insights to optimize ROI and drive business decisions.
Customer Journey and Pricing Strategy: Collaborate on customer journey mapping and pricing strategy, focusing on customer acquisition, retention, and alignment with GTM strategy.
Leadership and Cross-Functional Collaboration: Lead and mentor junior analysts, ensuring seamless collaboration with Marketing and Customer Experience teams for a cohesive GTM strategy.
Insightful Reporting and Dashboard Creation: Generate and present sales reports, and develop dashboards to monitor key metrics, aligning with marketing dashboards for comprehensive business performance insights


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: At least 5 years in sales analytics, with B2B SaaS sector knowledge. If you have extensive experience in product/marketing analytics and are looking for a shift into GTM, you are more than welcome to apply.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Snowflake and CRM platforms like Salesforce or HubSpot.
Analytical Ability: Strong analytical skills for generating actionable insights through advanced statistical techniques.
Communication: Excellent skills in conveying complex data insights in an understandable manner.


Cross-functional Experience: Proven experience in roles that require collaboration across Sales, Marketing, and other teams.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.

  • Customer Journey and Pricing Strategy: Collaborate on customer journey mapping and pricing strategy, focusing on customer acquisition, retention, and alignment with GTM strategy.
  • Leadership and Cross-Functional Collaboration: Lead and mentor junior analysts, ensuring seamless collaboration with Marketing and Customer Experience teams for a cohesive GTM strategy.
  • Insightful Reporting and Dashboard Creation: Generate and present sales reports, and develop dashboards to monitor key metrics, aligning with marketing dashboards for comprehensive business performance insights

Role Requirements: What you need to succeed

  • Experience: At least 5 years in sales analytics, with B2B SaaS sector knowledge. If you have extensive experience in product/marketing analytics and are looking for a shift into GTM, you are more than welcome to apply.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Snowflake and CRM platforms like Salesforce or HubSpot.
  • Analytical Ability: Strong analytical skills for generating actionable insights through advanced statistical techniques.
  • Communication: Excellent skills in conveying complex data insights in an understandable manner.

Cross-functional Experience: Proven experience in roles that require collaboration across Sales, Marketing, and other teams.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:

  • Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
  • Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
  • Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
  • Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
  • We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
  • We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Location: We are flexible! Come and join us either in Hamburg, Berlin, Barcelona or Athens.

FREENOW empowers smarter mobility decisions helping people to move freely and cities to thrive.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst (m/f/d) to collaborate with our product squads, using data to build a flawless product experience. You will join the Product Data Team and work closely with PMs, designers, UX researchers, developers, and other data functions to discover new product opportunities, validate hypotheses, and launch valuable features to our users.

Be ready to work in a multinational, diverse, highly motivated and collaborative team of passionate analysts who strive for excellence and like to have fun. Are you ready for your next ride?

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURES WILL INCLUDE:


Providing expertise and collaborating with stakeholders to generate new product feature ideas and improvements, and also estimating the potential impact of planned projects.
Continuously engaging with the product squads to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved, gathering requirements, and defining the best deliverables to match the business needs.
Having full ownership of your analysis, from ideation to communication of results and making recommendations to all levels of the company including senior management and prioritization committees.
Developing and evaluating A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released features, ensuring that we are launching the correct changes and features in our apps.
Working closely with our developers and data engineers to create and capture data that is aligned with the business logic and allows modeling and analysis.
Being involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process.
Bringing new insights and championing them using your analyses, dashboards, and good storytelling! We value ideas over hierarchy, and there's always a new path to follow if your idea is convincing and well-backed with data.
You will have the opportunity to steer our products, which kind of features should be developed, and which changes should be made to solve hundreds of thousands of users' daily needs.


TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:


You have curiosity in your essence, which motivates you to answer WHY things happened, not only scratching the surface, but aiming for well-founded actionable results
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background
3+ years experience in working as a Data Analyst in a data-driven analytics environment, preferably within tech product organizations, having direct contact with stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking, and proven experience in solving highly challenging problems.
Very good knowledge of SQL, databases, and statistical programming tools (e.g. Python, R) so that exploratory analyses can be performed, reports created and ETLs maintained
Good understanding and hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting A/B test results, backed by statistical knowledge.
Experience in working with data visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview) and event tracking (e.g. Mixpanel, GA, Firebase)
You are able to communicate findings in a concise and clear manner to a wide variety of stakeholders to support data-driven decision making by using data visualisation and storytelling and have excellent English communication skills.


BENEFITS & PERKS IN A NUTSHELL:


Flexible working arrangements
LinkedIn Learning
Sabbatical & special leave policies
WeRoad partnership
Birthday, 24th + 31st December off
Short term EU work policy
Mobility Credit
Health Insurance
Employee assistance program


Plus more local benefits depending on your work location!

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION:

FREE NOW is an equal opportunity employer and we consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age.

We want you to grow and evolve, bring your true self to work.

SEE WHAT OUR AWESOME COLLEAGUES SAY ABOUT US:


Show more
