Title: Data Analyst - Remote (UK)
Description:
About Us

At Dines, our mission is simple yet powerful: to serve those who serve. We empower hospitality businesses with a cutting-edge POS and payments platform, helping renowned festivals, events, theatres, and restaurants across the UK and Ireland operate seamlessly.

We’re more than just a technology provider – we’re a trusted partner built on three pillars: Relationships, Service, and Delivery. Our clients love us because we genuinely have their backs, and we take pride in being there when they need us most.

As we continue to grow, we’re looking for passionate individuals who share our vision and want to be part of something exciting. If you thrive in a fast-paced, team-driven environment where your work directly impacts businesses, we’d love to hear from you.

The Role

As our only Data Analyst, you’ll be building this function from the ground up – a department of one. That means we’re looking for someone confident working independently, shaping how data is collected, analysed, and shared across the business.

In this hands-on role, you’ll transform big data into actionable insights for leading food and beverage (F&B) businesses. Your work will directly influence how festivals, restaurants, and theatres make decisions, giving you a real impact in the industry.

You’ll collaborate with developers, clients, and internal teams to ensure data integrity, uncover insights, and help businesses make smarter, data-driven decisions. Accuracy, curiosity, and problem-solving will be key to your success here.

What You'll Do


Ensure data accuracy – Ensure the accurate flow of data and collaborate with developers to maintain data integrity.
Build dashboards & reports – Use QuickSight and other tools to simplify complex data for clients.
Investigate customer data queries – Provide clear, accurate resolutions to client concerns.
Support internal teams – Deliver insights to improve company strategies and decision-making.
Write & refine SQL queries – Manage large datasets efficiently to extract meaningful insights.


Who We're Looking For


Detail-oriented – You ensure data is accurate and reliable.
Problem-solver – You thrive on tackling complex challenges.
Curious & proactive – Always seeking better ways and fresh insights.
Clear communicator – Able to turn data into stories everyone understands.
Adaptable & independent – Comfortable in a fast-moving environment.
Collaborative – A team player who works well across functions.
Analytically strong – Skilled in SQL and data analysis.
Passionate about learning – F&B knowledge or experience helps, but enthusiasm for data matters most.


Why Join Dines?


Remote & Flexible: Work from anywhere in the UK and up to 30 days abroad annually.
Generous Leave: 30 days plus eight public holidays (five of which are flexible).
Personal Budgets: Invest in your well-being, learning, and workspace.
Impactful Work: Play a key role in shaping how top hospitality brands succeed.


Next Steps

After Reviewing Applications (please Submit a Cover Letter Along With Your CV!), We Will Invite Selected Candidates To Our Interview Process, Designed To Be Efficient And Engaging


Introductions with People Operations
Meet your Manager
Chat with the CEO


Ready to make an impact? Join Dines and help shape the future of hospitality tech!

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Fuse Energy is a forward-thinking renewable energy startup on a mission to deliver a terawatt of renewable energy - fast. We're combining first-principles thinking with cutting-edge technology to build a radically better energy system. We raised $100M from top-tier investors including Multicoin, Balderton, Lakestar, Accel, Creandum, Lowercarbon, Ribbit, Box Group and strategic angels like Nico Rosberg, the Co-Founder of Solana and GPs behind Meta, Revolut, Spotify, Uber and more.

We're creating a fully integrated energy company: from developing solar, wind and hydrogen projects to real-time power trading and distributed energy installations. By selling directly to consumers, we cut out the middleman, lower costs and pass on savings to customers.

But we're not stopping there. We're also building the Energy Network: a decentralised platform of smart devices that rewards users in Energy Dollars for electrifying their homes, shifting usage to off-peak hours, and helping balance the grid. This network strengthens grid stability - a critical foundation for scaling AI data centers and other energy-intensive industries.

Responsibilities


Develop and implement quantitative models to support hedging strategies for retail energy supply
Analyze market data to optimize the performance of physical assets such as solar and wind farms
Conduct statistical and scenario-based modeling to inform trading and risk management decisions
Monitor power markets, pricing trends, and regulatory developments to identify risks and opportunities
Collaborate with engineering and operations teams to integrate models into day-to-day decision-making


Requirements


1+ years of experience in quantitative modeling, data analysis, or a related role in energy, trading, or analytics
Strong proficiency in Python, with experience using libraries for data analysis, modeling, and visualization
Solid understanding of statistical modeling, optimization, and analysis techniques
Experience working with time series or market data, preferably in energy or commodities markets
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights


Benefits


Competitive salary and an equity sign-on bonus
Biannual bonus scheme
Fully expensed tech to match your needs
Paid annual leave
Breakfast and dinner for office based employees
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Zeal Group is one of the leading trading platforms with a focus on developing markets and great plans for international expansion.

At the heart of our company's data-driven strategy lies our Business Intelligence team, a specialized group dedicated to the art and science of data analysis. Our team is the backbone in transforming raw data into a treasure trove of insights, guiding the strategic direction of the company. With a laser focus on identifying and building key indicators for crucial areas within the organization, we strive to help key stakeholders in strategic decision-making.

We are a compact team of data analysts and BI engineers, each with a deep understanding of how data shapes business outcomes. Our expertise spans across various domains, enabling us to craft bespoke analytical solutions that meet the unique needs of different departments. From sales and marketing to operations and finance, our work informs strategies, optimizes performance, and uncovers opportunities for growth and innovation.

In our pursuit of excellence, we leverage cutting-edge BI tools and technologies, ensuring our stakeholders access reliable, timely, and actionable data. Our collaborative ethos fosters a culture of shared knowledge and continuous learning, enabling us to push the boundaries of what is possible with data.

As a Data Analyst/BI Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Your mission is to delve deep into the analysis of company indicators, unraveling the stories the data tells to empower business decisions, optimize processes, and drive product innovation. You will:


Analyze company indicators to provide actionable business insights and product improvement recommendations
Develop and own business intelligence solutions, including BI/data visualisation tools, dashboards, and reports to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders as a data business partner, understanding and defining business requirements for data assets
Develop and maintain the semantics layers of the data analytics platform through effective data modelling and data orchestration
Ensure data quality and integrity by establishing and enforcing data governance standards
Create and manage documentation, including technical specifications, data catalog, and other related documents for BI processes, systems, and procedures



Requirements


Fluency in SQL is a must (CTE, Window functions)
Hands-on experience with BI tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualizations (Power BI, Metabase or similar tools)
Proven track record of end-to-end implementation of data analysis projects, from gathering requirements and data processing to effectively presenting insights to stakeholders
Proficient in data modeling, building high quality datasets and products


Nice to have


Proficiency in Data Modelling, building high quality datasets and products
Experience in Python
Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
Background in online trading or related financial sectors



Benefits


State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
Flexible schedule and remote friendliness
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

Join the vibrant team at Student Castle Property Management Services Ltd (SCPMS), an esteemed player in the Purpose-Built Student Accommodation sector. Renowned for our commitment to excellence, we operate under two flagship brands – 'Student Castle' and 'Capitol Students.' Our unwavering aim is to create a warm and welcoming "home away from home" experience for all our student residents.




We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Data Analyst to join our growing team, supporting key

functions across revenue management, marketing, sales, and commercial strategy. The Data Analyst will collaborate closely with multiple departments, delivering data-driven insights to inform strategic decisions and drive business performance.




The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, bring a strong analytical mindset, and demonstrate a solid understanding of the PBSA market.




Key Responsibilities




Market Intelligence

Collect marketing intelligence on rental levels, occupancy rates, and market trends across PBSA sector and any other relevant sectors such as BTR and HMO.
Conduct marketing and competitor analyses to shape pricing decisions and revenue plans.




Analysis

Support pricing strategies by modelling demand scenarios, competitor benchmarks and seasonal trends.
Analyse and forecast rental revenue streams, identify opportunities for growth, and inform leasing strategies.
Collaborate with the sales team to refine rental proposals and optimize market rent strategies.
Monitor KPIs, identify anomalies, and suggest corrective actions based on data findings.
Analyse data for migration between legacy and new property management systems




Reporting

Develop accommodation schedules using floor plans, operational data, and client specifications.
Support budgeting, forecasting, and scenario modelling activities using Excel and financial models.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards and data visualizations using Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent tools.
Monitor and analyse system performance post-system migration to ensure ongoing data quality.




Data Management

Manage internal and external data sources, ensuring integrity and accessibility for business users.
Partner with other departments to ensure alignment between data insights and business goals.
Utilize SQL, Python, or R to extract, manipulate, and analyse data from various databases and systems.
Assist in data mapping, cleansing, validation, and migration between legacy systems and new platforms.
Develop and execute test plans to ensure data accuracy, system functionality, and reporting capabilities.
Work closely with IT, project managers, finance, operations, and other business units to resolve data issues and improve processes.
Document data flows, transformation rules, and implementation outcomes.




Other Responsibilities

Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business expansion initiatives and strategic planning.
Undertake additional tasks and ad hoc projects as required to support the overall business objectives and sales strategy.
Be flexible and responsive to evolving business needs and priorities.




What We're Looking For




Experience & Skills:

Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Statistics, or related).
Strong proficiency in Excel and SQL.
Experience using data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication skills to convey insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and work to tight deadlines.




Desirable:

Experience in the property, hospitality, or student accommodation sectors.
Familiarity with revenue management or dynamic pricing principles.
Proficiency in Python or R for advanced analysis or automation.
Experience with CRM or property management systems (e.g. Entrata, StarRez, Salesforce, Hubspot).




Personal Qualities:

A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can hit the ground running.
Reliable, trustworthy, and able to manage multiple priorities.
A keen eye for detail, with a passion for sophisticated and professional branding.




Why Join Our Team:

At SCPMS, we believe in fostering a work environment where our team not only excels professionally but thrives personally. When you become part of our dynamic family, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your well-being and celebrate life's milestones. Here's a glimpse of what we offer:

· 33 Days of Annual Leave: Because work-life balance matters.

· Life Insurance (4x Salary): We've got your back and your loved ones covered.

· Discretionary Bonus Scheme: Recognizing and rewarding your hard work.

· Health and Wellbeing Initiatives: Your health matters to us.

· Virtual GP Access: Easy and convenient healthcare at your fingertips.

· Health Cash Plan: Taking care of your health expenses.

· Company Paid Sick Leave: We support you during challenging times.

· Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Pay: Welcoming the newest members of your family.

· Maternity Wardrobe Support: Looking and feeling great during pregnancy.

· A Gift at the Birth of Your Baby: Because new beginnings deserve a celebration.

· Entire Day Off for Your Child’s First Day at School: Cherishing important moments.

· Me Day: Take a break, you've earned it.

· Access to Deals & Discounts: Enjoy exclusive perks.

· Career Celebration Awards: Recognizing your achievements along the way.

….. and more!

More details and eligibility criteria will be shared with the successful candidate!




Note: Due to high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy working with data?

Are you a problem solver?




About our Team: LexisNexis is a data and analytics company with 10,500 colleagues serving customers in more than 150 countries. We’re one of the largest information and analytics companies on the planet. We design solutions that help our customers increase productivity, improve decision-making and outcomes, and be more successful.




About the Role: As a Data Analyst III you will consult with internal stakeholders to understand problems, collect and analyze data to support data driven business decisions. This role uses data tools to collate, model, interpret, develop visualizations/information products, and communicate to the business. Specifically, individuals in this role will execute on projects/initiatives with high complexity independently.




Responsibilities:

Have an understanding of best practices
Execute on projects and initiatives independently
Providing support to the analytics team members
Leading analytics effort with high complexity
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand their business needs and to make suggestions for analysis and metrics to drive insights and recommendations
Understanding who the customers are and what is happening in the market with necessary commercial awareness
Creating visual displays of data through selected tools and analytical packages
Effectively lead and manage small/operational analytics projects




Requirements:

Bachelors or Master Degree in Data Analytics/Math or equivalent work experience
Ability to understand complex data structure and to apply advanced blending and refinement techniques including big data and knows how to apply advanced data preparation and refinement techniques
Significant experience leveraging SQL and Python for data querying
Experience with different visualizations tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in intermediate statistics
Have knowledge of big data platforms
Ability to present complex issues in simple and sophisticated insights
Ability to combine visualizations from multiple sources to tell an effective and engaging story
Knowledge of different project management approaches and lifecycles




Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you

We know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:

Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days
Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits
Wellbeing programs
Life assurance
Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme
Save As You Earn share option scheme
Travel Season ticket loan
Electric Vehicle Scheme
Optional Dental Insurance
Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children
RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you
Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer
Access to extensive learning and development resources
Access to employee discounts scheme via Perks at Work




About the Business

LexisNexis Legal & Professional are a leading global provider of legal and regulatory intelligence. We give organisations the business information and analytics they need to make better, more impactful decisions. We are building powerful new decision tools that use machine learning, natural language processing, visualisation and artificial intelligence that aid and enhance decision making.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




The Data Analyst role will be undertaken by a proactive and highly motivated individual. This hybrid role combines financial acumen with technical and analytical expertise to deliver high-impact projects and insights across the organisation.

You will be responsible for leading end-to-end project delivery in areas requiring new processes, systems, and reporting enhancements. This includes project scoping, stakeholder engagement, technical development, rollout, continuous improvement & maintenance of data driven processes.

You will also support the Finance team with key analytical, reconciliation, and reporting tasks, KPI analysis, and system optimisation.

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, technically skilled, and comfortable navigating both finance and commercial teams. A strong sense of ownership, curiosity, and a passion for automation and process improvement are essential for success in this role.




AREAS OF IMPACT




Project Delivery & Process Improvement Proactively identify areas of operational or financial improvement across the organisation.

Design and deliver scalable solutions through process redesign, automation, or system enhancements.
Lead projects from inception to completion, including stakeholder management, documentation, testing, and implementation.
Manage multiple concurrent tasks with clear timelines and deliverables.
Align projects with broader business goals, ensuring global efficiency and scalability.

Reporting & Analytics

Develop and maintain high-quality management reports, dashboards, and visualisations.
Create and track key performance indicators (KPIs) that support decision-making.
Provide timely and accurate financial insights for business and leadership teams.
Perform data validation and reconciliation between systems to ensure data integrity.

Commercial

Responsible for ensuring your client portfolio is updated in PBI to the latest numbers and that rates/forex/discounts are all correct.
Working with and supporting the Commercial FC/ SCM on your client portfolio within your entities, ensuring accurate forecasting, fees reviewed, and fee approval processes adhered to.
To review reporting across the Europe group to agreed deadlines, including:
Client servicing reports
Department paid for reports
Department utilisation reports
Responsible for ensuring any intercompany/shared fees within your remit are actioned in a timely manner and approved both sides.
Support on ad hoc commercial requests from the wider agency.
Training and support for the wider team and agency.




System & Data Management

Gain deep understanding of internal systems (ERP, BI tools, reporting platforms) from both user and backend perspectives.
Conduct regular data quality reviews and drive cleansing initiatives across core systems.
Liaise with external vendors and internal system owners to manage enhancements and feedback.
Ensure consistent data flow and source-of-truth alignment throughout the organisation.




Ad Hoc & Operational Support

Support the Finance team with ad hoc analysis and project-based needs.
Manage the preparation and delivery of management accounts for smaller entities if required.
Deliver internal training sessions in Excel, Power BI, and other BI tools to upskill teams and promote data literacy.
Serve as cover for core financial workflows during key periods or absences.




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & BEHAVIOURS




Technical Skills

Strong expertise in Power BI, Power Query, Power Automate, DAX, and Excel.
Proficiency in financial systems (e.g., ERP, FP&A platforms) and database tools.
Familiarity with data governance principles and best practices in Data Analytics.

Soft Skills

Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Strong time management skills; ability to prioritise and manage tasks across multiple stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a professional and collaborative approach.
Self-motivated, curious, and passionate about learning and innovation.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.




Desirable

Experience in/working closely with a Finance Team or held previous Finance related positions
Exposure to SQL or Python
Experience with API/Automation tools such as Zapier or Power Automate
Exposure to financial consolidation processes and multi-entity reporting.
Previous involvement in change management or systems implementation projects.

Development & Growth

We actively encourage ongoing professional development. You will be supported through:

Access to internal and external training resources.
Opportunities to lead or contribute to strategic initiatives.
A culture that values innovation, knowledge-sharing, and continuous improvement.

Development & Growth

  • Access to internal and external training resources.

  • A culture that values innovation, knowledge-sharing, and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Analyst (Commercial)
Description:
About Fresha

Fresha is the leading marketplace platform for beauty & wellness trusted by millions of consumers and businesses worldwide .

Fresha is used by 130,000+ businesses and 450,000+ stylists and professionals worldwide , processing over 1 billion appointments to date across 120+ countries.

The company is headquartered in London, United Kingdom , with 12 global offices located across North America, EMEA and APAC.

Fresha allows consumers to discover, book and pay for beauty and wellness appointments with local businesses via its marketplace, while beauty and wellness businesses and professionals use an all-in-one platform to manage their entire operations with an intuitive subscription-free business software and financial technology solutions.

Fresha’s ecosystem gives merchants everything they need to run their business seamlessly by facilitating appointment bookings, point-of-sale, customer records management, marketing automation, loyalty, beauty products inventory and team management.

The consumer marketplace unlocks revenue potential for partner businesses by leveraging the power of online bookings and automated marketing through mobile apps and advanced integrations with major tech brands including Instagram , Facebook and Google.

Role Overview

Given our exciting and progressive growth plans, we are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst (Commercial) to come and join our global business.

In this role, you'll be instrumental in driving our revenue growth , enhancing profitability , and identifying commercial opportunities across sales , marketing , operations , and product divisions .

Reporting to the Lead Commercial Analyst and collaborating closely with Engineers , other Analysts , and Commercial teams , you'll be developing data models , metrics , and insights that fuel our growth and open up new perspectives .

This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment , enjoys independent work , loves a challenge , and is eager to make a significant impact .

What You Will Be Doing


Effective Collaboration: Work closely with commercial, marketing, engineering, and even product teams to make an impact. Your role involves engaging with various stakeholders, integrating your analysis into their daily decisions, and understanding their diverse objectives and perspectives.
Influential Storytelling: You'll be turning complex analyses into compelling, actionable insights, persuading others to act on your findings.
Outcome Measurement: Develop metrics from complex commercial, product, and customer workflows to identify opportunities and inform decision-making at all levels.
Automation and Modelling: Experience in automating reports and metrics is essential for providing timely, intervention-free data access.
Tool Mastery: As part of a nimble company, you’ll need to be comfortable diving into various tools and setting them up to extract the insights we need.
Adapting to Change: Stay in tune with our commercial and marketing teams, ensuring our data models and strategies remain aligned with operational processes.


This list is not exhaustive and there may be other activities you are required to deliver.

To foster a collaborative environment that thrives on face-to-face interactions and teamwork, all Fresha employees work from the office four days per week, with the flexibility to work remotely one day each week.

What We Are Looking For


Proven experience in developing and implementing growth analytics strategies with commercial, marketing, sales, or product teams.
Expertise in transforming complex analyses into persuasive insights for decision-making.
Advanced skills in data analysis, particularly with SQL.
Familiarity with data modelling practices and pipeline development.
Extensive experience with BI/visualisation tools.
Experience working with cloud data warehouses.


Added bonus


Skills in Python/R.
Experience with Fivetran, Prefect, Snowflake, and Periscope.
Familiarity with writing ETL pipelines using SQL and Python, and orchestration tools like Airflow or Prefect.
Background in experimentation.
Experience in fast-paced, venture-backed startup environments.


At Fresha, we value passion and potential as much as specific skills. If you're enthusiastic and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet every listed requirement. We believe in fostering growth and providing the support needed for you to excel in your role.

Interview Process


Screen call - Video-call with a member from the Talent Team - 30m
1st Stage - Video-call with Hiring Manager - 45m
Presentation - In-person with Hiring Team - 60-90m


We aim to finalise the entire interview process and deliver feedback within 2 weeks.

Every job application received is reviewed manually by our talent team. While we strive to assess applications within 7 days, the sheer volume of talented individuals expressing interest may occasionally extend this timeframe.

Inclusive workforce

At Fresha, we are creating a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable.

We want all Fresha people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment.

We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the interview process and/or once you join, please let us know so that we can support you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Surrey/Hybrid

Competitive Salary + Benefits




We are working with a global, market-leading company, who are hiring a Data Analyst to strengthen demand planning and forecasting across Europe. This role combines statistical expertise with commercial insight, delivering forecasts that guide strategic business decisions and drive performance across multiple markets.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage statistical forecasting models to support demand planning.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior stakeholders.
Influence decision-making across commercial, finance, and supply chain teams.
Ensure forecasts are objective, data-driven, and aligned with business priorities.
Participate in integrated business planning, portfolio, inventory, and supply meetings to provide intelligence, guidance, and recommendations.
Serve as a bridge between technical forecasting outputs and practical business applications.
Coding is not required - focus is on interpreting and applying existing models effectively.




Required Experience

5+ years of experience in forecasting, demand planning, or applied statistics.
Strong understanding of statistical techniques and forecasting methods.
Proven ability to present data clearly and influence senior stakeholders.
Commercial awareness and experience linking forecasts to P&L outcomes.
Experience working in multinational or multi-country environments.




If this sounds of interest, please apply to discuss further.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Power BI Analyst




Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: Up to £55,000




Uneek are working with a leading professional services business who are looking for a Power BI Analyst to join their growing Data team!




If you enjoy transforming data into powerful insights and building dashboards that make an impact, this could be your next move..




Highlights:

• Building and maintaining high-quality dashboards and reports in Power BI

• Connecting data from multiple sources (SQL, Excel, APIs, cloud platforms)

• Ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and business-ready

• Partnering with senior stakeholders to deliver reporting and actionable insights

• Automating processes to save time and improve efficiency




Requirements:

• 2+ years’ experience working with Power BI (Desktop & Service)

• Strong skills in DAX, Power Query, and SQL

• Experience in data modelling and ETL processes

• Able to translate technical detail into clear insights

• Detail-focused and able to manage multiple priorities

• Finance/business background is a plus

• Azure, Power Automate, or Python knowledge is desirable




Interview Process:

30-minute Teams call

Final stage face-to-face interview

Title: Data analyst
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst

£35,000 - £40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)

Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role

The Marketing Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau to provide and improved view of how customers are engaging with marketing products and campaigns. The Marketing Data Analyst will conduct and advise on analysis to help with the optimisation of both new & existing products & features.




As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will:




Deliver Analysis for Marketing Products & Marketing Campaigns.
Identify the impact of marketing approaches and audience segmentation.
Analyse campaign success, develop KPI metrics, and optimise future campaign tactics.
Monitor and report on marketing campaign performance.
Assist with the development and execution of marketing strategies.
Identify new ways to use data to deliver opportunities to engage with customers, optimise channels, and deliver cost effectiveness.
Ensure enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of marketing products, features, and campaigns, building compelling visualisation and case studies to be shared with the business.
Advise on how advanced statistical techniques can further improve the understanding of the customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Marketing Data Analyst.
Proven experience working with marketing data for audience segmentation and profiling.
Experienced analysing data from A/B and MVT.
Strong data visualisation skills (Tableau is preferred).
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Experience working with customer data, segmentation, targeting and behavioural analysis.
Can showcase impactful and actionable insights.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Location: London (Hybrid - 2-3 days/week in office)
Salary: £35,000

A well-established professional services firm is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to support its growing analytics and insights team. This is an ideal role for someone with a keen eye for data, looking to build a strong foundation in analytics within a collaborative, commercially focused environment.

The Role:
You'll work alongside experienced analysts and business stakeholders, helping to transform raw data into clear, actionable insights. From data preparation and cleaning to supporting dashboards and regular reporting, you'll play a key part in driving smarter decision-making across the business.

What You'll Be Doing:

Preparing, validating and analysing data from multiple internal systems

Assisting with the creation and maintenance of dashboards and regular reports

Supporting ad-hoc analysis and insight requests from across the business

Working closely with the senior analytics team to continuously improve data processes

What We're Looking For:

Strong Excel and data handling skills (SQL knowledge a plus)

A methodical, detail-oriented approach to working with large datasets

Some familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI or Tableau) is desirable

Eager to learn, with a genuine interest in using data to solve business problems

Quantitative degree from a leading university is essential

You'll be based in London 2-3 days a week, with flexibility around remote working. This is a great opportunity to start or build your career in a role where development and learning are encouraged.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Are you interested in politics and social issues? Are you just starting out in political, social and reputational research? Do you want to work with data to help tackle some of the biggest challenges in politics, reputation, and business? That’s why Stack Data Strategy exists.




We work with political parties, major corporates and NGOs around the world to help them understand public opinion, how it affects them, and what they should do in response to it.




From helping us analyse key electoral trends to measuring the reputation of some of the world’s biggest companies, you’ll work alongside a world-class team with multi-disciplinary backgrounds covering statistics, data science and engineering, political science, market research and economics.




We’re filling roles at Analyst level, come and join us!




Salary: Competitive and dependent on experience

Contract: Full time and permanent

Location: London

Start Date: ASAP




What you’ll be doing:

Your days will be varied and full, with plenty of opportunity to learn. You’ll be:

Leading engagement with clients across the range of our work, including political parties, investors, NGOs, corporates and government departments
Managing the entire research process, from drafting surveys, designing sampling strategies, managing data collection, and processing results.
Producing analysis and translating it into clear and actionable reports and presentations for an exciting range of clients. 
Learning and applying the fundamentals of data analysis, including regression, segmentation, principal component analysis and more. 
Combining quantitative and qualitative data to produce authoritative advice to clients across the public, private and not-for-profit sectors on strategy and campaigning.




What you’ll bring:

Your own way of thinking: we want to increase the cognitive diversity of the team with every new hire.
A strong interest in public opinion, and in politics, with an appetite to engage with a variety of political and corporate clients.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, openness to new ideas, and a desire to learn. 
The ability to deliver complicated tasks in limited time, and the confidence to eventually do so without oversight.




Ideally you’ll have:

One or two years’ experience in data analysis and/or polling and research. (You don’t need direct experience of data modelling, we’ll train you up in our way of doing things.)
Ideally some familiarity with programming languages like Python or R. (We very much welcome applications from people who are just starting out with these tools, you don’t need to be any kind of expert.)




How to apply

Please send us your CV and pick two of the following questions to answer in a covering email or letter, taking no more than three paragraphs to do so per question (use of data definitely encouraged). 




This exercise is designed to test your own analytical thinking and writing, so please make sure that your answers reflect original work. We understand that tools such as ChatGPT can be useful in the writing process but we encourage you to avoid submitting answers which are fully AI-generated. Submissions that rely too heavily on LLMs/AI are often easy to recognise and will negatively affect your application. 




Send all that to info@stackdatastrategy.com with the subject: Analyst Role




How could the Conservatives win at the next UK General Election? 
Who would be the most effective candidate for the Democrats to win the presidency in 2028?
Will populist right-wing parties permanently displace the centre-right across Europe, or will they remain a protest movement?
What is the route back to relevance for France's two previously dominant parties: Les Republicains and Parti Socialiste?




Should you be considered for interview, we will contact you by email within two weeks of receiving your application.










Stack Data Strategy is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of your age, any disability you may have, your gender or gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, sex or sexual orientation. As part of our commitment to equal opportunities, we are always open to discussions about alternative working patterns or hours and try to maximise the scope for talented people to contribute to Stack’s mission!




Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments to be made during recruitment or in employment for reasons associated with your physical or mental health. We are committed to ensuring everyone is able to contribute to Stack in whatever way is most appropriate for them.

Show more

As part of our commitment to equal opportunities, we are always open to discussions about alternative working patterns or hours and try to maximise the scope for talented people to contribute to Stack’s mission!

Title: Data and MI Analyst
Description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Data and MI Analyst to join a highly respected Investment Bank in London. You will play a pivotal part in ensuring that all data and management information processes are delivered accurately and efficiently, adhering to both internal procedures and regulatory requirements.

What You'll Do

As a Data and MI Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of all data-related activities within the Client Lifecycle Management function. Your day-to-day tasks will involve handling complex datasets, performing reconciliations for both internal use and regulatory compliance, as well as documenting essential procedures. You will be expected to communicate effectively with colleagues across departments when investigating data discrepancies or resolving queries. Your ability to manage your workload independently while remaining an active contributor to team projects will be crucial for success. By providing accurate management information in a timely manner, you will directly support decision-making processes throughout the organisation. The role also offers opportunities to participate in ad hoc projects that further develop your analytical skills while fostering a culture of collaboration.


Maintain and report on all data and management information across multiple platforms, ensuring timely uploads and oversight of internal reporting repositories.
Manipulate, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and consistency for both internal stakeholders and regulatory bodies.
Conduct ad hoc investigations into data issues, communicating findings clearly to resolve queries efficiently.
Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reconciliations as well as prepare reports required for internal governance and external compliance.
Document and update procedures related to data management and management information processes to ensure best practices are followed at all times.
Demonstrate ownership of assigned deliverables by producing outputs that are both timely and accurate, reflecting a high standard of responsibility.
Monitor shared mailboxes diligently, responding to queries with professionalism and clarity.
Assist colleagues within the team on various projects as needed, sharing knowledge to enhance overall team performance.
Support the wider Data and Management Information Team by contributing positively to communal goals and initiatives.


What You Bring

To excel as a Data and Management Information Analyst in this setting, you will bring proven experience in managing complex datasets within regulated environments—ideally within financial services or banking. Your background should reflect not only technical proficiency but also interpersonal strengths such as empathy, dependability, and a genuine commitment to supporting others. You will have demonstrated your ability to work collaboratively within teams while taking responsibility for individual deliverables. Your analytical mindset enables you to identify trends or anomalies quickly while your communication skills ensure that findings are shared constructively across departments. A keen eye for detail ensures accuracy in every aspect of your work—from routine reconciliations through to documentation updates—while your openness towards learning new systems or processes helps drive continuous improvement throughout the team.


A minimum 2:1 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification demonstrating academic achievement relevant to the field.
Excellent organisational abilities paired with effective time management skills that enable you to handle multiple priorities simultaneously.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills that allow you to explain complex data concepts clearly to non-technical audiences.
Advanced numerical aptitude combined with strong analytical thinking for interpreting large volumes of information accurately.
High level of computer literacy with proven experience in manipulating data using Excel functions such as VLOOKUPs, XLOOKUPs, Index/Match, Pivot Tables.
A customer-centric approach gained through previous roles where client satisfaction was paramount.
Demonstrable ability to support change initiatives by identifying process improvements or innovative solutions within existing frameworks.
Collaborative mindset with a willingness to share knowledge openly for the benefit of the entire team’s performance.
Sound understanding of the banking industry landscape along with familiarity with Know Your Customer (KYC) principles.
Meticulous attention to detail coupled with a sense of accountability for delivering quality outcomes


Robert Walters Operations Limited is an employment business and employment agency and welcomes applications from all candidates

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
A purpose-driven technology group is seeking a Business Analyst to support a major data transformation initiative within its Commercial Transformation team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on mapping complex data journeys, improving data governance, and enabling better decision-making through streamlined processes.

Key Responsibilities

Map high-level ‘As Is’ processes, identifying key subprocesses, stakeholders, and areas of risk or inefficiency
Document data flows across systems, including dependencies and downstream impacts
Analyse and design improved ‘To Be’ data models and processes
Support the development of data governance frameworks and tools
Prepare materials to support executive-level discussions and decision-making

Key Requirements

Strong communication and facilitation skills
Proven experience in mapping ‘As Is’ and ‘To Be’ processes
Proficiency with process mapping tools (Lucid preferred)
Analytical mindset with a passion for simplifying complexity
Technical proficiency and familiarity with CRM, ERP, and Service Management systems
Desirable: experience or qualifications in Business Process Redesign or Six Sigma

Details

Start date: ASAP
Duration: 6-month contract (with potential to extend)
Day rate: £400 - £500 Ltd / £250 - £350 PAYE
Location: Remote-first with occasional in-person meetings (London-based)

Show more

Title: Client Success & Insights Analyst
Description:
THE BUSINESS

illuma is a British AI company pioneering contextual solutions for enterprise since 2014. Its real-time scaling technology is used by brands and agencies to boost the results of digital advertising campaigns. Meanwhile, broadcasters, publishers and online platforms use illuma to organise, classify and categorise their inventory for commercial activation.

illuma is committed to sustaining the open web ecosystem through equitable collaborations between adtech providers and media owners. The company is proudly building industry-first agreements that recognise publishers' intellectual property rights, and in turn, deliver better outcomes for brands and audiences.

illuma is a leading voice in contextual adtech, and our news, commentary and success stories are reported in titles such as The Guardian, Digiday and ExchangeWire.

illuma was founded in 2014 by publishing experts and computer scientists from Imperial College, UCL and Cambridge University. The company is based in London with additional offices in New York.

At illuma we are curious, innovative, and progressive, committed to seeking new, intelligent solutions to business problems. You will be working with and learning from some of the brightest minds in AI, tech and data science, and you won't be just a cog in a wheel, you will have an active voice with the opportunity to make real impact and grow your career with us as we scale.

Purpose

We are looking for a highly motivated and personable Client Insights Manager to join our growing team. This hybrid role blends client success and data-driven insight generation, supporting our Data, Product, and Client Success teams across EMEA and the US.

You'll be responsible for building and nurturing client relationships, interpreting data to uncover strategic insights, and delivering compelling presentations that drive campaign performance and client satisfaction. You'll also play a key role in pitching, upselling, and supporting new business development.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Client Success & Relationship Management


Define and execute insights strategy across product offerings
Manage a portfolio of advertisers and agencies, launching campaigns and aligning internal resources to meet goals
Build and grow client relationships, anticipating needs and identifying upsell opportunities
Lead client communications, including proposals, pitches, and ongoing relationship-building
Attend industry events and network to expand your client base and pipeline


Insights & Data Strategy


Collaborate with Data teams to request, analyse, and interpret data from multiple sources
Create engaging decks and presentations to showcase insights and campaign recommendations
Manage the Automated Insights Product, including audits, support, and iterative development
Act as the point person for all insights queries and operational strategies


Sales, Marketing & Operations


Partner with marketing to surface insights for campaigns and social content
Provide insights for sales enablement and RFP collateral


Requirements

Skills & Requirements


Excellent written and spoken English
Highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Business Intelligence tools (e.g. PowerBI, Metabase, Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL and Python or R for statistical programming
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to translate complex data into clear, goal-focused insights
Comfortable communicating with non-experts and cross-functional teams
Experience in digital advertising (DSPs, SSPs, Ad exchanges) is preferable
Up to date on industry trends and able to articulate them confidently
Strong team player with attention to detail and a proactive mindset
Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and global collaboration


Benefits

Benefits


25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Private medical insurance
Half price gym membership
Pension
Team socials, stocked fridge, snacks
We operate a Hybrid working model with initially the opportunity to work remotely for up to one day a week increasing to two days after successful probation period


Equal Opportunity StatementWe embrace diversity fully and promote an inclusive environment to enable everyone to do their best work.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Our Values


Humility
United
Driven
Focused
Innovative
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer Intern
Description:
About the Company




Aries Global is a fast-growing, founder-led group of profitable software companies, positioned at the forefront of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem and driving transformation through a shared AI-powered infrastructure. Our mission is to unify niche SaaS companies under one scalable platform — amplifying their growth through strategic alignment, operational leverage, and centralised intelligence. With permanent capital and a commitment to long-term value creation, we invest ~$200M per year into acquiring and scaling software businesses. We're looking for a curious, motivated intern to join our Analytics Engineering team. If you’re excited about transforming raw data into powerful insights using modern cloud data tools, this internship is a great opportunity to gain real-world, production-grade experience.







About the Role




As an Analytics Engineer Intern, you’ll help us build the foundation of our data products, reliable data models and intuitive dashboards. Your contributions will ensure business users can confidently take actions and access metrics that matter.







Responsibilities




Build and maintain Data models and Products that power critical dashboards, processes and reporting tools.
Help manage and optimize data pipelines in dbt & Snowflake, our primary data warehouse.
Collaborate with analysts and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and design intuitive, self-serve solutions.
Design and maintain dashboards in Sigma that empower non-technical users.
Assist with documentation, data testing, and quality checks to ensure data integrity.
Work closely with the data engineering team on schema design, performance, and pipeline best practices.







Qualifications




Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a different field, with strong interest and experience in data.







Required Skills




Strong SQL skills and an understanding of relational databases.
Familiarity with Python or other coding language.
Exposure to Snowflake or another cloud data warehouse.
Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Sigma, Tableau, or Looker.
Interest in data modeling, fast moving environment, and analytical thinking.
Good communication skills and a collaborative mindset.







Preferred Skills




Exposure to real-world data workflows and business use cases.
Hands-on experience and ability to build a modern techstack.
Mentorship from experienced analytics engineers.
Insight into how high-growth companies use data to drive decisions.
Opportunities to contribute to projects that get used across the business.







Internship Logistics




Start Date: Flexible (ideal: August–September 2025)
Length: 4–6 months, with potential to extend
Application Deadline: Rolling
Location: London







How to Apply




Send your resume and a short note explaining:




Why you’re excited about analytics engineering.
Any projects or coursework where you’ve used SQL, Snowflake, or dashboarding tools.




Equal Opportunity Statement




We are committed to diversity and inclusivity in our hiring practices.

  • Opportunities to contribute to projects that get used across the business.



Internship Logistics


  • Start Date: Flexible (ideal: August–September 2025)

How to Apply


Send your resume and a short note explaining:


  • Why you’re excited about analytics engineering.
  • Any projects or coursework where you’ve used SQL, Snowflake, or dashboarding tools.


Equal Opportunity Statement


We are committed to diversity and inclusivity in our hiring practices.

Title: Data Management and Reporting Executive (Entry Level)
Description:
About WPP Media

WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.

WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com

About Mindshare: A Leading WPP Media Brand

Mindshare delivers Good Growth for its clients. As “Growth Architects," we drive growth that benefits all stakeholders — better for people, planet, and business — by using media with intention. This approach creates more meaningful connections with consumers, increases consumer trust in the brand, and delivers better outcomes for all stakeholders.

Role Summary and Impact

An increasingly fundamental and differentiating capability for any marketing led organisation is the ability to control data and analyse it to create knowledge. Repeatable knowledge needs to be actively cultivated and re-applied across the business to help interpret granular analytics.

This is an existing role within the ‘Team Unilever’ Data Management & Reporting Team based at the Mindshare Worldwide office in London.

As our client, Unilever is investing considerably in this area in a bid to ensure its marketing is visible, rigorous, and measured, and Mindshare is a key partner, playing a key role in the collection, reporting, and analysis of media and marketing data from over 70 countries.

The roles will report directly to our DQ (Data Quality) and Reporting leads, and will also work with the broader Unilever worldwide client team at Mindshare, local media agencies, and the Mindshare Technology Team. The immediate team is made up of 6 people (including this position).

Skills And Experience

At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:


Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


Precision, accuracy, and efficient management of data and reporting is the priority for an executive. You must demonstrate execution of agreed working practices and expert data handling & reporting skills. You need to be a confident but friendly communicator – in person, on the phone, and via email. Most importantly, enthusiastic, and eager to learn about the world of media.

Essential Criteria


Strong attention to detail
Desire to work with data combined with a passion for media and marketing
Demonstrates a high degree of accuracy even when under pressure
Organised and efficient with the ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks
Proficient in using Microsoft office programs such as Excel, Outlook, Word
Someone who’s not afraid to speak up and give his/her opinion, with the ability to use, monitor and question data to deliver the best outcome
Desire to work within a team environment, able to take direction from various members of the team and action accordingly
Inventive: Diagnoses problems by identifying and understanding the cause of the problems
Build relationships: Builds rapport with others in order to develop productive and effective relationships at work
Initiative and Drive: Effectively prioritises multiple tasks; takes appropriate actions to avoid/manage issues


Key Responsibilities

Requirements

The Data Management and Reporting Team is set up as a dedicated team to manage the data quality and reporting requirements from various proprietary Mindshare systems and data sets used for reporting to Unilever. There are two primary focus areas for the role:


Data Management responsibility: the role is to sit in-between the local agencies (which are the source of data inputs) and the Technology team at Mindshare, to quality control all data. The role’s scope is to work with the local agencies to correct any issues at the source. This spans 2 key data sources [media investment and media budget recommendation]. The responsibility includes (but is not limited to) the following:
Validating the local country media plans and ensuring they have been correctly formulated (timing, product, brands, campaign, media channel, advertising format etc)
Validating each budget file is in the correct template, with the mandatory fields populated
Ensuring that the budget file inputs and budget setting levels are aligned with the media investment data
Cross-checking investment against previous months by Country, Category, and Local Brand in a validation logbook
Distributing monthly Validation/Acceptance reports to all Mindshare country teams to have data corrected at the source
Ensuring Local Mindshare teams work with local Unilever marketing teams to confirm correct campaign names are being used in MAP (Mindshare’s global media reporting system). DQ team will add new campaigns to systems where necessary.
Educating the local Mindshare countries with the benefits of the system and responsibilities - aka ‘single source of truth’
Reporting responsibility includes (but is not limited to) the following:
Managing monthly production of KPI reports - excel based
Understanding the data inputs, how they are defined, how it fits with the various reports and the purpose and objective of the report for end users
Adhoc client/market/team requests to source information and address local/global client data sourcing and reporting requirements – this might include but not be limited to competitive advertiser analysis reports, case studies and media plan information requests
Become familiar with multiple Mindshare-managed Data sets/media planning tools etc in order to support the above requests
Collect and collate best practices and case studies from our local teams and share these across our network


Life at WPP Media & Benefits

Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising. We have a variety of employee resource groups and host frequent in-office events showcasing team wins, sharing thought leadership, and celebrating holidays and milestone events. Our benefits include competitive medical, group retirement plans, vision, and dental insurance, significant paid time off, preferential partner discounts, and employee mental health awareness days.

WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

Please note this is a UK based role and requires individuals to have the right to work in this location

Please read our Privacy Notice (https://www.wppmedia.com/pages/privacy-policy) for more information on how we process the information you provide.

While we appreciate all applications received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

As our client, Unilever is investing considerably in this area in a bid to ensure its marketing is visible, rigorous, and measured, and Mindshare is a key partner, playing a key role in the collection, reporting, and analysis of media and marketing data from over 70 countries.

Title: Manager, Data Analytics
Description:
At a Glance:

👨‍💻 Position: Manager – Data Analytics

👫 Team: Strategy & Technology

📍 Location: Dubai, United Arab Emirates

📄 Contract: Full-time

🏢 Type: On-site / Hybrid

💷 Benefits: Attractive fixed & variable pay




About Us 🥇

At Idealz Holding, we’re redefining retail with our flagship “Shop & Win” model — transforming everyday shopping into extraordinary winning experiences 🎉. With a presence spanning 4 continents and over $100M in prizes awarded, we sit at the intersection of commerce, technology, and data.

Data is the heartbeat of our growth 🚀 — powering smarter decisions, sharper campaigns, and stronger customer loyalty. We’re now looking for a Manager – Data Analytics & Insights to unlock opportunities hidden in the numbers and turn them into strategies that fuel expansion 🌍.




Role Description 📝

As the Manager – Data Analytics & Insights, you will be responsible for building and optimizing data-driven frameworks that guide decision-making across Idealz. You’ll analyze financial, operational, and customer data, design predictive models, and deliver insights that shape campaigns, customer engagement, and revenue strategy. This role is perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of analytics and business strategy — able to zoom into the data while advising leadership at the highest level.




What You’ll Be Doing ✅

Build and manage analytics frameworks, dashboards, and reporting systems for real-time business intelligence.
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and business KPIs to uncover growth opportunities.
Develop predictive models and ROI-driven insights to optimize campaigns and product performance.
Partner with product, marketing, and operations teams to ensure strategies are insight-backed and commercially impactful.
Monitor key KPIs to drive improvements in conversion, retention, and overall revenue performance.
Conduct competitive and market analysis to support innovation and expansion strategies.
Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership, influencing strategic direction.
Promote a data-first culture across the organization by empowering teams to make informed decisions.




Skills & Qualifications 🧩

7–10 years of experience in data analytics, business insights, or data science, ideally within B2C, retail, e-commerce, or tech-driven businesses.
Strong skills in SQL, Python/R, and BI tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).
Proven ability to translate large, complex datasets into actionable business strategies.
Experience with predictive modeling, campaign analysis, and customer lifecycle analytics.
Excellent communication and storytelling ability to influence both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of customer behavior, funnel optimization, and campaign ROI.
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or a related field.




The Process ➡️

1️⃣ Initial screening with Global Head of HR

2️⃣ Second interview with Senior Manager – Strategy

3️⃣ Case study / business analytics assignment

4️⃣ Interview with General Manager

5️⃣ Final interview with CEO

⏱️ Process typically concludes within 3–4 weeks.




Why Join ⁉️

At Idealz Holding, you’ll join a fast-paced, global team that thrives on innovation, data, and disruption. This role gives you the opportunity to shape the analytics backbone of a company reinventing retail on a global stage 🌍. You’ll have the freedom to experiment, the tools to deliver impact, and the platform to influence strategy at the highest level.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
If you are seeking a new opportunity within an innovative company that is always looking for ways to keep up with ever changing technology, then you have come to the right place.



You will play an integral part in some of our largest projects supporting innovation and automation within the Business and dealing with all things technology.



We are looking for a focused Business Analyst to join our energetic team and assist us in our technology transformation journey.





Job Description


Build a deep understanding of the business, its products, processes and SOPs
Identifying and documenting project objectives and benefits
Eliciting, analysing, validating and documenting business requirements for various IT products
Translating business needs into clear, prioritised requirements (user stories, acceptance criteria).
Producing ‘as-is’ and ‘to-be’ process maps
Creating wireframes and mock-ups to support the business requirements
Liaising with the business and 3rd party suppliers throughout the project lifecycle
Performing stakeholder analysis and managing expectations across business and technical teams.
Contributing to change management activities by supporting communication and adoption of new processes or systems (including solution designing, testing, training, support etc.)
Contribute to continuous improvement through peer reviews, knowledge sharing and adoption of best practice BA techniques


Qualifications


Minimum 4 years experience working as a BA
Good knowledge of requirements eliciting techniques and project delivery methodologies (agile and waterfall)
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft core products
Experience using requirement and project collaboration tools (e.g. JIRA, Azure, DevOps)
Experience of working within IT project teams
The ability to plan and co-ordinate multiple tasks
Strong stakeholder management skills
Excellent interpersonal, communication, influencing and negotiation skills
Analytical and problem-solving ability
Strong attention to detail
High-level of creativity, adaptability and persistence
Energetic, passionate and driven
Experience with ERP systems or a finance background - desired


Additional Information


22 days annual leave increasing to 25 after 1 years service & with length of service
Free onsite gym with weekly classes
Free breakfast, lunch and snacks in our onsite canteen "The Hangar"
Private healthcare and pension
Cycle to work scheme
2x giving back days per year
Continued professional development

Check us out on social media! LinkedIn - Facebook - Instagram - TikTok - Twitter - Youtube



Diversity and Inclusion:



Here at ACS we're passionate about bringing people together to create a truly inclusive environment that promotes and values diversity, across our global network of offices.

Title: SAINT LAURENT PR Intern - Fixed Term Contract
Description:
Summary

ABOUT SAINT LAURENT
Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury prêt-à-porter in a 1966 collection called ‘Rive Gauche’, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the sociocultural landscape. In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe. Today, Saint Laurent collections include women’s and men’s ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Job Description

ABOUT SAINT LAURENT

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury prêt-à-porter in a 1966 collection called ‘Rive Gauche’, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the sociocultural landscape. In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.  Today, Saint Laurent collections include women’s and men’s ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.  

ROLE

As the PR Intern, you will be part of the London Press Office working alongside the PR Manager, Press Officer and PR Assistant. The role will focus on womenswear & menswear RTW and accessories.  

MISSION


Manage sample trafficking and oversee PR Assistant in coordinating samples for editorial requests achieving print and digital coverage for womenswear & menswear RTW and accessories collections in all media partner & target UK outlets.
Maximize brand exposure and coverage across editorials, product placements, news and digital.
Oversee daily, weekly and monthly coverage reports.
Proactively work with the collections and celebrity placements to pitch focus products and generate product and news stories placements keeping UK media engaged with the brand.   
Research UK media outlets, print and digital, following industry trends and movements to keep the brand on target and relevant within the UK market.
Manage and organize seasonal press day with Press Officer.  
Meet regularly with UK target outlets to build relationships and deliver media coverage.  
Work closely with the PR Assistant ensuring full training and support.  
Liaising with internal departments and international offices on a daily basis.


PROFILE


Be passionate about communication and fashion with a strong knowledge and understanding of the industry
Experience working with a team
Excellent organisation and time management skills with a result driven mentality
Ability to thrive and adpapt in a dynamic, busy and fast paced environment
Proficient in Microsoft office including Word and Excel and Fashion GPS
Show and event experience
Strong attention to details and ability to complete tasks accurately
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Proficient in Microsoft office including Word and Excel


Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background

Job Type

Fixed Term (Fixed Term)

Start Date

2025-10-03

Schedule

Full time

Organization

Yves Saint Laurent UK Ltd

Title: Associate Analyst / Graduate Econometrician - Marketing Science - 2025 Economics Graduates (2.1 or above)
Description:
Associate Analyst / Graduate Econometrician - Marketing Science - 2025 Economics Graduates (2.1 or above)




Flexible Hybrid Working - London offices twice a week




Up To c£35,000 DoE




Job Reference J13002




A professional and rapidly growing, independent consultancy specialising in advanced analytics has a new opportunity for a graduate econometrician to join their team. You will have studied an Economics / Econometrics based degree at university and develop it in a commercial environment in marketing science and analytics. Full training and support provided for those with the enthusiasm and aptitude to learn.




This job will involve:

• Assist in the development and execution of Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM) projects to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing strategies across various channels.

• Conduct data analysis, statistical modelling, and interpretation of results to provide actionable insights and recommendations to clients.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data, refine methodologies, and present findings in client meetings and reports.

• Prepare clear and compelling presentations and reports using Excel and PowerPoint to communicate key findings and insights.

• Contribute to the continuous improvement of analytical processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance the quality and efficiency of our services.

•

The successful candidate will have the following skills:

• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.

• Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with proficiency in statistical analysis and econometric modelling.

• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex concepts and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, with a proactive and results-driven approach.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint; experience with R/Python for data analysis and visualisation is a plus.

• Prior experience or coursework in marketing analytics, econometric modelling, or related fields is preferred but not required for recent graduates.

•

If this sounds like the role for you then please apply today!
