Description

We’re seeking a Power BI Specialist to lead the administration, support, and development of Power BI as a business-focused, enterprise-grade data visualization platform. In this role, you’ll apply your expert knowledge of data-oriented solution design, Microsoft 365, and the Power Platform to deliver scalable, impactful solutions that meet a wide range of business needs.

You’ll be responsible for developing Power BI artifacts including apps, reports, and dataflows along with configuring platform settings and supporting users across the organization. You will also be responsible for the growth and adoption of the overall low code platform at Ledcor.

This is a hands-on, collaborative role ideal for a technically strong professional who’s passionate about driving business outcomes through data, automation, and modern collaboration technologies.

Come join our True Blue team in Vancouver today!

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Contributing to initiatives, projects, enhancements, and defects involving the collaboration platforms and services supported by the team
  • Developing solutions to improve business processes and workloads that are supported by the collaboration platforms
  • Providing consultation and discovery services to end-users, with a focus on identifying how the collaboration platforms can help them solve business challenges
  • Providing Tier 2/3 support and education to end-users and business stakeholders
  • Providing support and assistance to internal team members to ensure the successful completion and flow of work
  • Administering, monitoring, and configuring supported platforms and services to ensure reliability, affordability, agility, and security
  • Assists in the definition of objectives and initiatives for the supported platforms, including architecture and planning
  • Explores new solutions and technologies by key vendors / partners. Engages in training and learning opportunities that contribute to team success
  • Identifies and establishes continuous improvement opportunities for the team, including contributing to team objective setting

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering or related field
  • 5+ years’ experience with data visualization / reporting technologies (minimum of 3+ years with Power BI)
  • Proven experience in software development or related technology industries

1055 West Hastings St, Vancouver, BC

Title: IT Support Administrator
Description:
Project

The Woodfibre LNG Project is located approximately 7 km west-southwest of Squamish, British Columbia. It involves the construction and operation of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facility on the previous Woodfibre pulp mill site, which would have a storage capacity of 250,000 m3 and would produce approximately 2.1 million tons per year of LNG.

Woodfibre Management Ltd. is a privately held Canadian company based in Vancouver and a subsidiary of Pacific Energy Corporation Limited.

Position

The IT Support Administrator position is integral to Woodfibre LNG's dynamic team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with and provide your technical input to employees at all levels in the business on various technical topics. You will be a trusted partner in infrastructure implementations, upgrades, and fixes. You will be relied upon to continually contribute to industry best practices to improve department practices. You will play a key role in supporting the entire team across multiple locations in North America. The successful candidate reports directly to IT Manager, and this role is based in the Vancouver Office, BC.

Key Responsibilities:

The successful applicant will:


Level 1 support, be the first point of contact to provide IT assistance to multiple locations in North America
Manage IT support tickets daily (troubleshoot and resolve, escalate when necessary)
Operate desktop hardware/ software/mobile computing device configurations in accordance with Company standards and procedures
Work with Corporate IT in Asia to ensure that desktop standards are adopted, implemented, and maintained appropriately. In addition, to liaise with Corporate IT to resolve issues and requests
Escalate incidents and problems, as necessary, to the appropriate team, Site IT Delivery, or vendor, while actively retaining ownership of the incident on behalf of the customer
Manage vendors working on desktop maintenance/enhancements to ensure that services are being delivered and complete on time and within budgeted cost
Actively engage users when they report issues and notify users upon resolution
Be aware of service interruptions and follow up closely until resolution
Ensure appropriate levels of equipment spares are maintained across the business
Evaluate all Change Requests that impact users. User experience before and after implementation must not change and any change must be actively communicated and managed
Provide end-user training and preparation of the related materials
Create and maintain documentation for site IT operations support e.g., Desktop configuration documentation, end-user PC equipment deployment records and upkeep of knowledgebase related site IT operations issues
Upkeep and maintain an accurate record for site IT PC and equipment inventory
Other duties as assigned


Requirements

Required Experience:


Diploma in IT with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
Working knowledge of:
LAN/MAN/WAN/VLAN, and VOIP technologies
Desktop/ laptop and printing hardware
Windows server technologies.
Windows 10, 11 configuration and troubleshooting
Familiar with Microsoft 365 and experienced in troubleshooting Outlook issues
Video Conferencing solutions
Supporting mobile device computing like Laptops, mobile phones, CCTVs, and IP phone systems
An understanding of:
VPN
Windows Active Directory and Microsoft Azure
Microsoft 365 Exchange mail server technologies
Security concepts and technologies
Cisco routers, switches, and network cable management
VR knowledge is strongly preferred.
Self-starter disciplined and worked under minimum supervision. Able to execute tasks independently
Customer service oriented / interactions with users. Possess excellent soft skills and be cost conscious
Understanding of how IT infrastructure and applications can support business processes and other software applications
Seek opportunities, develop, and maintain knowledge. Receptive to performance and developmental feedback


Additional Requirements:


Ability to efficiently multi-task and be self-motivated while working with others
Ability to remain cool and controlled in a crisis and when under pressure
Ability to convey information to both a technical and non-technical audience
Experience working with large multi-disciplinary teams, contractors in a multicultural environment is an asset.
Communication/interpersonal skills - to be able to interact with front line workers through to management and all hierarchical levels.
Accepts responsibility and demonstrates commitment to delivery of tasks and targets
Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks and changing priorities within tight time frames
Demonstrates and seeks accountability within team.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment
Expertise with a variety of computer programs (e.g., Office 365, MS Teams)
Motivated and willing to take ownership of tasks
Energetic in pursuit of continuous improvement processes
Shares knowledge readily and encourages personal development
A valid driver's license and passport
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
The position is based in the Company's Vancouver Office with possible opportunity to travel to the Squamish, BC (Project Site) and EPC contractor's Office in Houston, as required to provide technical support.
